stories.text:
Which problems of the big picture are you approaching? And how are you approaching them?

I'm active in the canonical debate lab where we research on scalable collaborative argument mapping, voting systems, community moderation, truth algorithms and social protocols.

We'd like so see and motivate a bit more activity in this field.

Recently we tried to identify the main challenges and write them down. Here is the result: https://canonicaldebatelab.com/CIDesign/
stories.title: Ask HN: Who is working on collective intelligence systems?
Why Does Tech Do This to Grownups
Could you land a plane in an emergency?

stories.text:
Looking for suggestions/resources on where to look into understanding commentary about old programming references (notes circa 1950's / 1960's)

aka. could use row on punch cards as "page number" to machine sort dropped group of punch cards, which at 2 ^ 7 gave max ~127 index references.

For higher order number of punch cards & simpler/less expensive sorting, use felt tip marker to add lambda mark along side of block of punch cards.
stories.title: Resources for 50s/60's programming lore?
Rytr is an AI writing assistant that helps you create high-quality content
CandyCodes: Simple universally unique edible IDs for fighting fake drugs
Around: Video calls loved by extraordinary teams
Fascia: A sleep mask for conducting sleep studies [pdf]
Usability: The wonderful, powerful idea that betrayed us (2021)
